item.title: Deleting, and adding Items 718. (READ TO UNDERSTAND)
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:4, topic:519765”]He was saying to store the count of 15262 before you delete it. IE

int i = getCount(15262)
deleteAll(15262)
add(12183, 5000 * i)[/quote]
Thanks buddy, all working now.

Read full topic

item.title: Deleting, and adding Items 718. (READ TO UNDERSTAND)
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

But it isn’t a set amount of 15262 I want to remove I want to remove how ever many items is in the inventory. and times it by 5000 and add 12183.

Read full topic
item.source: Deleting, and adding Items 718. (READ TO UNDERSTAND)

item.title: Deleting, and adding Items 718. (READ TO UNDERSTAND)
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Well deleting the items is the first thing you’re doing. So the second part won’t work the way you want because the items are already deleted.

Store the amount of items deleted in a local variable and then refer to that instead of the items in the player inventory.

Read full topic
item.source: Deleting, and adding Items 718. (READ TO UNDERSTAND)

item.title: Deleting, and adding Items 718. (READ TO UNDERSTAND)
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

if (itemId == 15262) { player.getInventory().deleteItem(itemId, player.getInventory().getNumerOf(itemId)); player.getInventory().addItem(12183, player.getInventory().getNumerOf(itemId) * 5000); }

What I want to happen is that it will delete the ItemId 15262 and delete all of that item that is in the Inventory. It does that.

But then I want it to add Item 12183 and add 5000 of that item per Item 15262 is deleted.

So if 100 Item 15262 is deleted then add 500,000 of item 12183? get me?

Read full topic
item.source: Deleting, and adding Items 718. (READ TO UNDERSTAND)
